units.title: Seed hPSCs in ultra-low attachment plate for aggregate formation
units.text: On d-4, 5,000 cells are seeded per well of an ultra-low attachment 96-U-well plate, followed by centrifugation to form one hPSC aggregate.
units.rationale: This is a precise, actionable step in the protocol that initiates HFO formation with specific cell number and plate type.

units.title: Centrifuge plate to form single aggregates
units.text: Centrifuge the plate at 300g and 4 °C for 3 min to bring the cells to the culture plate bottom, and place the plate into the incubator.
units.rationale: This step ensures proper aggregate formation by pelleting cells uniformly, critical for consistent HFO development.

units.title: Embed aggregates in Matrigel on d-2
units.text:
Two days after seeding (d-2), the hPSC aggregates are embedded in Matrigel droplets.
Take out the required amount of Matrigel aliquots from the freezer and let them thaw on ice. When the Matrigel is thawed, insert the aliquots into the ice. Take out the sterile scissors (heated to at least 180 °C for at least 3 h), and let them cool down at room temperature.
units.rationale: This is a key procedural step in HFO development, requiring specific timing and technique to maintain aggregate integrity.

units.title: Transfer aggregates into Matrigel droplets
units.text:
Pick a properly formed aggregate. To do this, use the cut tip (fr... droplet from the plate bottom.
Add 100 µL E8 per well. A multichannel pipet can be used in this step. Add the medium slowly and carefully, depressing the plunger of the pipet only until the first stop to prevent damage and floating of the Matrigel droplets.
units.rationale: This step describes the critical technique of transferring aggregates into Matrigel without excess medium or damage.

units.title: Initiate differentiation with CHIR99021 on d0
units.text:
Two days after embedding aggregates (d0), differentiation of the hPSC aggregates is initiated.
CHIR99021 7.5 μM; 24 h
IWP2 5 μM; 48 h
units.rationale: This marks the start of the key differentiation phase, timed precisely after Matrigel embedding.

units.title: Assess HFOs by microscopy and analysis
units.text: Before proceeding with further experiments, HFOs should be assessed under an inverted microscope (to observe the HFOs from the culture plate bottom) to ensure proper patterning. Analysis of HFOs can be performed by various methods, including staining and imaging, scRNAseq or flow cytometry.
units.rationale: This outlines the mandatory quality control and downstream analysis steps required after differentiation.
